Legal_Issue: Whether the Director General breached the duty of fairness by not allowing the applicant to respond to objections
Evidence_Assessment: Failure to provide opportunity to respond to objections
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate breach of procedural fairness
Legal_Rule: Duty of fairness requires opportunity to respond to objections in certain administrative processes
Standard_of_Review: Correctness or reasonableness, depending on context
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness in decision process
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to allow response to objections prior to decision
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Breach found due to lack of opportunity to respond
Key_Evidence_Considered: Timing of objections and responses, sequence of decision-making
Legal_Framework: Administrative law, common law fairness principles
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged validity of approval due to unfair process
Court_Result: Judicial review granted, costs awarded to applicant
Defendant_Response: Did not allow applicant to respond before decision
Outcome: Decision quashed, no referral back allowed under s. 18
Applicable_Process: Administrative approval with right to object
Governing_Rule: Common law duty of fairness in administrative decisions
